content.label: I started playing Particle Mace on the PC version, which has all the different ships. I was sad to see that the iOS version didn’t support that. Hoping to see that at some point in the future! The reason I rate this game 3 stars is that the positioning of the control circle for the ship is in a not great spot on the phone screen. Every other game, I end up causing the swipe up menu (with the volume/WiFi/etc controls) to pop up in the middle of my round. It’s super frustrating. I wish there was an option move it up or something because despite how much I love this game, this bug/feature is so frustrating.
Unfortunately this app no longer works on iOS 11. I loved this game and will truly miss it. Thanks for the fun times!
Super fun game ^_^
Best new gameplay mechanic I've seen in years. Fun and addictive

It's a really fun and well put together game. You fly a ship trailing a weapon that flexes with the ships movement (like a whip) You take out enemies and asteroids with the end of the whip. Its all procedurally generated and has levels of difficulty and unlockable ships. It's brilliant in design and execution. I've not had any crashes or any lag. Very nicely done. Thank you devs! When are we getting Particle Mace 2?
I am through the missions 3x--and still open it up to play around from time to time. Money well spent imho

this is my fav game at silent barn ~ would happily give the app a five star rating if we were able to change our ships like on the console. thank you much for making this & bringing it to the ios, but i miss my jelly :')

title.label: What a fun time!!!!!! great game, and added to my favorites folder!

content.label: we played this at a video game convention, and it was our favorite for indie games. and for all games we played. so much fun with other players. and just great as one player.  its worth the cash. just a great game and addictive in the good ways. :)

Great game! I recommend this game to anyone. Awesome gameplay and graphics. It entertained me for hours. The only problem I have is that I can't figure out how to beat spiral racer 2. This level seems impossible to me. Does anyone have any advice on how to beat it?
I AM SO ADDICTED

I feel I must note the issue was fixed pretty shortly after my last comment. I'm not going to claim it was my doing with any overwhelming certainty, but I'm currently adding this to the leadership section of my resume. Anyway, thanks guys. Great game.
Great game to play while commuting or waiting in a terminal.

Great game, and interesting idea! Nicely done kinetics of the particles and feedback sound and visual of hits and kills...however, while satisfying as the camera shake is when you get a kill, I'd tone it down a notch because when you get to some serious multi kills which are essential for getting those top scores, the rapid successive camera shake makes it almost impossible to see where your ship is going and usually results in you hitting something. This is frustrating when you're trying to get #1 scorning on Hard ;)
Great game but they really need to fix the glitch with the black hole mission. You die instantly, making it impossible to progress.
in a high score game that's unacceptable. hopefully won't happen again

title.label: YOU WANT EVERY PARTICLE OF THIS!!

content.label: BLACK HOLE MISSION BUG IS FIXED ON IPAD AIR!!  This game borders on perfection.  The graphics are brilliant.  The gameplay is outstanding.  The controls are great.  There are different games.  There are missions.  And there are asteroids and foes.  What more could you ask for?  GET IT NOW!!
space game featuring tight controls, elegant graphics, and compulsive gameplay. Excellent.

I don't give five stars often but this game certainly deserves every one of them. It has a few modes -- most are high score arcade games (that are super fun) but what really impressed me were the 150 missions. The difficulty increased nicely over time and by the last mission I was a pro, it felt like I had really accomplished something. The controls felt a little odd at first but I got very comfortable with them in just a little time. Great minimal art, cool music and sound effects, and just a really rich game smartly built from a simple premise/game mechanic. Awesome stuff. When you're done with the missions you can chase high scores in the more arcadey modes.

Fun game but in mission mode I'm at a spot where it spawns right in the middle of a black hole...die immediately on entering the level....which means no more mission mode...which means no new ships from mission mode...fix and I'll change to 5 stars, but now I feel I'm being killed of at least a third of the whole game.

This is a great game with solid and innovative mechanics, at a fraction of the desktop cost. Buy it now. This game could use the ability to focus on one mission at a time in mission mode as playing "clover" with "asteroid belt" is infuriating. It could also use multiplayer, coop and competitive, like in the desktop version.
It's nearly impossible to go downwards on iPhone 6

I love the game but I've just run into a huge bug which makes it unplayable. In Mission Mode, I've reached 117 of the 150 missions and now suddenly the game freezes every time I go back to beat more missions. I'm running a 5S on the latest software. I've restarted the game and the phone to no avail. The game just stopped working. I tried app support but it seems the only way to report a problem is through Twitter, and I don't have a Twitter account. As soon as this is fixed, it'll be a 5 star game easily.

High score games are not my bag, but a ton of folks were saying this transcended that genre and it does fo sho.  Mission and ship unlocks keep a one more time playing mentality long after bed time has come.

So good! it was always crowded at the arcade so I'm glad i can play it myself. my only wish is that the control wheel could be anywhere on the screen. oh and multiplayer like the arcade version- but it's great!!!

Particle Mace is great. The controls are dead simple, but the gameplay is fun and challenging enough to keep me interested for long periods. Plus, the graphics, music, and SFX give the game a great retro/arcade vibe.
Great controls and satisfying, challenging gameplay. It's a lot of fun; I can't stop slamming stuff into stuff!

title.label: Fantastic Arcade Shooter With A Twist...

content.label: Pummel the ships with your particle mace!  My favorite game of 2015, by far.  Great controls and 4 different modes. This is an awesome contemporary take on the classic 80's arcade shooter.  I love it!

This games reminds me of the mace in tilt to live sans motion controls.  There's a robust mission mode and a variety of ships, which takes a really solid foundation and makes it essential.   Great sound and visuals, plus the text is charming.  A contender for game of the year for sure!
If you consider yourself a gamer get it now.  Terrific arcade type.
There's really nothing else like this - great controls and a simple, awesome mechanic. All the different objectives are great, too. Try the robot ship - it's the best one by far!

This could become very addictive! The concept is simple but the strategies are complex. You need to expand your awareness to include your entire spacely environment moving toward and away simultaneously. The control of the ship is incredibly responsive. The music is soothing. I love every part of this game.
It was the best of times, it was the worst of times, it was the age of wisdom, it was the age of foolishness, it was a great time to FIGHT YOUR FRIENDS

Addicting campaign and arcade modes with tons of replayability and leaderboards. Lots of ships which can be used to purpose suit missions or for a new challenge. Great controls, graphics, and sound. Get it!

I can't get enough of this game! The controls are tight, graphics are so cool and the sound is something else.

Do yourself a favor and pick this up post-haste.

title.label: One of my favorite PC games!

content.label: Finally! Particle Mace is an outstanding retro-arcade indie with a new and innovative twist (quite literally). This is my go-to game at parties - my friends love it. So happy I can finally play on the go. Must buy! A++.
